title: Hugo Reinert (@hugo@assemblag.es)

last_post.content:
I've talked about this in smaller contexts, but I haven't found any traction and time is getting short. When the Nazis passed the enabling laws for the book burning on April 8th, 1933 — exactly 90 years ago in 34 days — the first thing they burnt, the same day, were the archives of the largest trans and gay research institute in the world. When they say now that we didn't exist until after the war, the only reason they can get away with it is that they burned all the accumulated evidence. :boost_ok:

https://assemblag.es/@hugo/109972631252644527

title: core-js/2023-02-14-so-whats-next.md at master · zloirock/core-js

last_post.content:
I read something like this and it's heartbreaking.

This is literally the guy in that XKCD comic that maintains a tiny piece at the bottom of a huge JavaScript stack that would fall over if he just stopped maintaining his open source library for free one day.

And because he's not a good self-promoter, whenever he tries to ask for money all he gets is hate and vitriol in response.

Open source, man. I love it, but the tech industry sucks.

https://github.com/zloirock/core-js/blob/master/docs/2023-02-14-so-whats-next.md

title: The retention problem: Women are going into tech but are also being driven out

last_post.content:
“Women make up only 9.8% of the people who contribute to open-source software projects. . . . our research found that women’s negative experiences range from minor to severe harassment, sexism, discrimination and misogyny to explicit death threats. Their expertise is challenged, their contributions are not well-received and their roles are diminished.” - Vandana Singh

https://theconversation.com/the-retention-problem-women-are-going-into-tech-but-are-also-being-driven-out-200625
#OpenSource #WomenInTech

title: Mastodon References for Astronomers on Twitter - @TrueSciPhi

last_post.content:
Looking for more science & math on Mastodon?

Astronomers w/ >100 followers: https://truesciphi.org/ast_mas.html

Physicists w/ >100 followers: https://truesciphi.org/phy_mas.html

Science writers w/>500 followers: https://truesciphi.org/psw_mas.html

Mathematicians w/ >100 followers: https://truesciphi.org/mat_mas.html

As relatively new low-threshold lists seeded from Twitter, many accounts likely are missing. I'm happy to receive suggestions for additions by public or private reply. Inclusion criteria are linked at the top of each list.

https://theconversation.com/the-retention-problem-women-are-going-into-tech-but-are-also-being-driven-out-200625

I, um, wrote a 📘 about this stuff if anyone's interested. Tho it's not a best-practices text as much as 1st principles. Ch 3 is about codes of conduct:

title: The impact of satellite trails on Hubble Space Telescope observations - Nature Astronomy

last_post.content:
Hubble's Orbit Has Dropped so far that Starlinks are Phobobombing its Images

With the rise in satellite constellations, astronomers are finding that more and more of their images have a satellite trail obscuring some of their data. Just use space telescopes? Unfortunately, it appears that space telescopes like Hubble are having the same problem. Hubble's orbit has been decaying for years, and it's now so low that it's beneath Starlink shells. A new study reveals some of the satellite trails passing through science images.

https://www.nature.com/articles/s41550-023-01903-3

title: "Transgenderism should be eradicated from public life, entirely."

last_post.content:
#transphobia #genocide #cpac #recycled_nazism

85 years ago, under the German Nazi regime, the Institute of Forensic Medicine recommended that the “phenomena of transvestism” be “exterminated from public life.”

A few days ago US conservative Michael Knowles said, live streamed from the CPAC 2023 conference in the USA, that “transgenderism must be eliminated from public life entirely,” in an eerie, almost word-for-word, echo of Nazi Germany.

title: Mastodon client for the Apple IIc

last_post.content:
In other retro Mastodon client news...

@colin_mcmillen has created a Mastodon client for Apple II! It was developed and tested on an Apple IIc, and uses an external Raspberry Pi for stripping SSL, parsing JSON, and converting charsets. It's fully featured and even supports displaying images!

Video that showcases it: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HtCq50Qqwo8

More info in his blog post (focusing on the proxy/API): https://www.colino.net/wordpress/archives/2023/02/07/accessing-the-internet-with-an-apple-c/

UPDATE: You can now download it from here: https://www.colino.net/wordpress/archives/2023/03/06/binary-release-of-mastodon-for-the-apple-c/

#RetroProgramming #RetroComputing #AppleII

title: Inside the Suspicion Machine

last_post.content: NEW: Every year, governments use algorithms to flag people receiving welfare benefits as "high risk" of committing fraud. Today, for the first time, a joint investigation by Lighthouse Reports and WIRED can reveal how one of these algorithms works. We obtained the full algorithm code and the training data and recreated the system. What we found was discrimination based on gender and ethnicity. Part 1 is here: https://www.wired.com/story/welfare-state-algorithms/

title: Mastodon•ART 🎨 Curator :masto: (@Curator@mastodon.art)

last_post.content:
Reminder: I don't (a lot of people don't) boost posts that don't have either alt text, image descriptions, or a request for help adding descriptions.

See https://mastodon.art/@Curator/109279035107793247 for a guide on how to write and add alt text, and the many ways you can ask for help with them if you're low on spoons.

Accessibility is important; alt text helps people who are blind, partially sighted, have colour blindness, or even just poor internet connections where images don't load but the alt text does!

New BIML Bibliography entry #MLsec

https://arxiv.org/abs/2210.13966

The Debate Over Understanding in AI's Large Language Models

Mitchell, et al @melaniemitchell

This paper is an excellent problem statement that clearly points out the criticality of understanding “understanding” in current ML systems. Makes an excellent primer.

See https://berryvilleiml.com/references/

title: A Privacy Hero's Final Wish: An Institute to Redirect AI's Future

It was also a kind of soft launch for the AI safety institute that he wanted to be his legacy.

title: How to help someone use a computer

last_post.content:
@steve @timnitGebru I think about him a lot as well. He had one of the fundamental documents to my work (helping people learn how to use computers) and I refer to it probably weekly even though it was written in 1996. https://pages.gseis.ucla.edu/faculty/agre/how-to-help.html
As he says on his copyright page "Nobody is born with these skills, they are rarely taught, and unequal access to them is an unnecessary force for inequality"

title: Real World Data Science - US legislators get their data science act together

last_post.content:
On February 14, a bipartisan group of US legislators introduced the Data Science and Literacy Act with the goal of boosting access to data science education and building “America’s 21st century STEM workforce”. Brian Tarran, editor of Real World Data Science, sat down with guests Zarek Drozda, Anna Bargagliotti, Christine Franklin and Steve Pierson to discuss the news and to hear why data science education is “the new apple pie”.

#DataScience #DataLiteracy #Education

https://realworlddatascience.net/news-and-views/editors-blog/posts/2023/03/06/data-science-act.html

title: IAS Science Journalism Workshop Application | Forms

last_post.content:
I’m thrilled to announce a new workshop for aspiring and early-career science journalists, happening July 10-15 at the Institute for Advanced Study in Princeton.

Travel costs, meals, lodging generously covered by the Simons Foundation and the IAS.

It's going to be a wonderful week! Apply here: https://forms.ias.edu/form/ias-science-journalism-workshop.

Please share.🙏

title: https://visdeurbel.nl

last_post.content:
#BREAKING: the Fish Doorbell is LIVE! 🐟 🛎️

Fish migrate down Utrecht's waterways every spring, but the lock is rarely opened then. Hence, the "fish doorbell". If you spot fish on this literal live stream, you can send a photo to the lock-keeper to alert them to open the gates!

Migration really gets going in April, so stay tuned.

https://visdeurbel.nl

title: 25 people become US citizens at 1st Bangor naturalization ceremony in 3 years

last_post.content:
During the pandemic, the federal district court in Bangor (#Maine) stopped giving the oath of citizenship F2F to new #citizens. But it just resumed and swore in new citizens from Azerbaijan, Bangladesh, Burundi, China, Cuba, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ecuador, France, Iceland, Peru, the Philippines, Rwanda, Somalia, Syria, and Ukraine.
https://www.bangordailynews.com/2023/03/04/news/bangor/bangor-us-citizens-naturalization-joam40zk0w/

The judge made a great statement, worth reading.

title: Activists Say They Drilled Holes in CGL Pipeline, Sabotaged Materials | The Tyee

last_post.content:
It’s getting serious out on the pipeline-obstruction front: https://thetyee.ca/News/2023/03/01/Activists-Sabotage-CGL-Pipeline/

If you want to express an opinion on this kind of action, I strongly suggest that first you go read “How to Blow Up a Pipeline” by Andreas Malm: https://www.versobooks.com/books/3665-how-to-blow-up-a-pipeline

It’s short, readable, and does not include instructions for damaging pipelines. But it does consider the ethics carefully.

FWIW, my thoughts here: https://www.tbray.org/ongoing/When/202x/2021/11/09/Climate-Crisis-Resistance
